channel.title: Pixelmeasurer
channel.description:
[center][size=15pt]Welcome[/size]
[i]I've been researching a basic client. I've designed a executable program that can find a coordinate on the screen of a client. It's also used for moving sprites, adding sprites and other basic information. I'm not sure if i'm aloud to release this program as it's a file converted from game creation language.[/i]
[img]http://i30.tinypic.com/2mfdvew.jpg[/img]
[size=15pt]Credits[/size]
[i]Dacoste14.[/i][/center]

item.title: Pixelmeasurer
item.dc:creator: @Epic_One Epic One
item.description:
@Epic_One wrote:

[quote=“x19, post:10, topic:212479”]Telenubby, RS2E and RS2DV are completely diffrent.

RS2E is just wL with the thread per client fixed and packaged.[/quote]

That shit isn’t packaging. Nor is it worth a look at.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:3, topic:212479”]And…
The point of this is…
?[/quote]
He can just make a method to outprint the mouses x and y coords… It would be easier to put your mouse somewhere and see where it is lol.

item.title: Pixelmeasurer
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“Mrs Extro Limited, post:4, topic:212479”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=279830.msg2276598#msg2276598 date=1213481984]
And…
The point of this is…
?
[/quote]
look in the bottom right hand cornor, some people are now asking how to find out the coords of where they are on their server
i used this on winterlove servers

if (command.equals("coords") { sendMessage("X: "+absX); sendMessage("Y: "+absY); sendMessage("Height: "+heightLevel); }

now i use this for my rs2E server

if (command.startsWith("coords") { p.sendM("X: "+absX); p.sendM("Y: "+absY); p.sendM("Height: "+heightLevel); }[/quote]Wow. Wow at the fact you believed this was server-sided editing and that you even said you used it for that, and a big wow that you’re ruining RS2D already by hardcoding in every command.

Read full topic

item.title: Pixelmeasurer
item.dc:creator: @Dacoste14 Dacoste14
item.description:
@Dacoste14 wrote:

I can’t remove the green background. I need to add a source that renues the coordinate source. I can change the colour but.

Read full topic

item.title: Pixelmeasurer
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

[quote=“Mrs Extro Limited, post:4, topic:212479”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=279830.msg2276598#msg2276598 date=1213481984]
And…
The point of this is…
?
[/quote]
look in the bottom right hand cornor, some people are now asking how to find out the coords of where they are on their server
i used this on winterlove servers

if (command.equals("coords") { sendMessage("X: "+absX); sendMessage("Y: "+absY); sendMessage("Height: "+heightLevel); }

now i use this for my rs2E server

if (command.startsWith("coords") { p.sendM("X: "+absX); p.sendM("Y: "+absY); p.sendM("Height: "+heightLevel); }[/quote]

Wow, you’ve completely misunderstood the purpose of this program. It’s client-side editing reasons, not for server reasons. You can use it to move around sprites, such as side icons, etc… So you wont have to do trial and error all the time.

Read full topic

The point of this is…
?[/quote]
look in the bottom right hand cornor, some people are now asking how to find out the coords of where they are on their server
i used this on winterlove servers

if (command.equals("coords") { sendMessage("X: "+absX); sendMessage("Y: "+absY); sendMessage("Height: "+heightLevel); }

now i use this for my rs2E server

if (command.startsWith("coords") { p.sendM("X: "+absX); p.sendM("Y: "+absY); p.sendM("Height: "+heightLevel); }
